title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement rmagno@pattern.institute. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Mouse Genetic Markers
text: MGI (Mouse Genome Informatics) provides three reports Mouse Genetic Markers: read reports R, can use helper read_report(), see examples .

title: Mouse Genetic Markers
text: Including withdrawn marker symbols: Note withdrawn genetic markers indicated status "W" (withdrawn), marker_name typically reads "withdrawn, = 2610205H19Rik" --date symbol. Excluding withdrawn marker symbols:
code: (base_url <- "https://www.informatics.jax.org/downloads/reports") #> [1] "https://www.informatics.jax.org/downloads/reports" (mrk_symbols1 <- read_report(file.path(base_url, "MRK_List1.rpt"), "MRK_List1", n_max = 30L)) #> # A tibble: 30 × 12 #>    marker_id   marker_symbol marker_name marker_type status cM_pos chr     start #>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <fct>       <fct>   <dbl> <fct>   <int> #>  1 MGI:1341858 03B03F        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  2 MGI:1341869 03B03R        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  3 MGI:1337005 03.MMHAP34FR… DNA segmen… DNA Segment O        NA   11    NA      #>  4 NA          0610005A07Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   3     NA      #>  5 MGI:1918911 0610005C13Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        29.4 7      4.52e7 #>  6 NA          0610005K03Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   15    NA      #>  7 NA          0610005M07Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   6     NA      #>  8 NA          0610006A03Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   4     NA      #>  9 NA          0610006A11Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   NA    NA      #> 10 NA          0610006C01Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   NA    NA      #> # ℹ 20 more rows #> # ℹ 4 more variables: end <int>, strand <fct>, feature_type <fct>, #> #   synonyms <list> mrk_symbols1 |>   dplyr::filter(status == "W") |>   dplyr::select(c("marker_symbol", "marker_name", "marker_type", "status")) #> # A tibble: 25 × 4 #>    marker_symbol marker_name                marker_type status #>    <chr>         <chr>                      <fct>       <fct>  #>  1 0610005A07Rik withdrawn, = Gstm7         Gene        W      #>  2 0610005K03Rik withdrawn, = Lypdc2        Gene        W      #>  3 0610005M07Rik withdrawn, = Acn9          Gene        W      #>  4 0610006A03Rik withdrawn, = Fuca          Gene        W      #>  5 0610006A11Rik withdrawn, = Blvra         Gene        W      #>  6 0610006C01Rik withdrawn, = 2610205H19Rik Gene        W      #>  7 0610006F02Rik withdrawn, = Mettl7b       Gene        W      #>  8 0610006G05Rik withdrawn, = Sostl         Gene        W      #>  9 0610006G08Rik withdrawn, = Brp44l        Gene        W      #> 10 0610006G17Rik withdrawn, = Hirip5        Gene        W      #> # ℹ 15 more rows (mrk_symbols2 <- read_report(file.path(base_url, "MRK_List2.rpt"), "MRK_List2", n_max = 10L)) #> # A tibble: 10 × 12 #>    marker_id   marker_symbol marker_name marker_type status cM_pos chr     start #>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <fct>       <fct>   <dbl> <fct>   <int> #>  1 MGI:1341858 03B03F        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  2 MGI:1341869 03B03R        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  3 MGI:1337005 03.MMHAP34FR… DNA segmen… DNA Segment O        NA   11    NA      #>  4 MGI:1918911 0610005C13Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        29.4 7      4.52e7 #>  5 MGI:1923503 0610006L08Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        NA   7      7.45e7 #>  6 MGI:1925547 0610008J02Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        NA   NA    NA      #>  7 MGI:3698435 0610009E02Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        18.9 2      2.63e7 #>  8 MGI:1918921 0610009F21Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        NA   16     9.17e7 #>  9 MGI:1918931 0610009K14Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        NA   4      1.36e7 #> 10 MGI:1914088 0610009L18Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        84.1 11     1.20e8 #> # ℹ 4 more variables: end <int>, strand <fct>, feature_type <fct>, #> #   synonyms <list>

title: Mouse Genetic Markers
code: (mrk_coordinates <- read_report(file.path(base_url, "MGI_MRK_Coord.rpt"), "MGI_MRK_Coord", n_max = 10L)) #> # A tibble: 10 × 12 #>    marker_id marker_type marker_symbol marker_name  genome_assembly chr    start #>    <chr>     <fct>       <chr>         <chr>        <fct>           <fct>  <int> #>  1 MGI:87853 Gene        a             nonagouti    GRCm39          2     1.55e8 #>  2 MGI:87854 Gene        Pzp           PZP, alpha-… GRCm39          6     1.28e8 #>  3 MGI:87881 Gene        Acp1          acid phosph… GRCm39          12    3.09e7 #>  4 MGI:87926 Gene        Adh7          alcohol deh… GRCm39          3     1.38e8 #>  5 MGI:87929 Gene        Adh5          alcohol deh… GRCm39          3     1.38e8 #>  6 MGI:87859 Gene        Abl1          c-abl oncog… GRCm39          2     3.16e7 #>  7 MGI:87882 Gene        Acp2          acid phosph… GRCm39          2     9.10e7 #>  8 MGI:87862 Gene        Scgb1b27      secretoglob… GRCm39          7     3.37e7 #>  9 MGI:87883 Gene        Acp5          acid phosph… GRCm39          9     2.20e7 #> 10 MGI:87930 Gene        Adk           adenosine k… GRCm39          14    2.11e7 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: end <int>, strand <fct>, feature_type <fct>, #> #   provider <fct>, provider_display <fct>

code: @Manual{,   title = {mgi.report.reader: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports},   author = {Ramiro Magno and Isabel Duarte and Ismail Gbadamosi and Ali Jawaid},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/patterninstitute/mgi.report.reader/},   url = {https://www.pattern.institute/mgi.report.reader/}, }

title: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports
text: mgi.report.reader provides readers easy consistent importing Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) report files: https://www.informatics.jax.org/downloads/reports/index.html. Essentially, package provides single function read_report() import MGI reports. try use consistent naming scheme variables across reports, use appropriate variable types, e.g. factors variables small enumerations, convert disparate missing values NA, time-consuming tidying steps, don’t .

title: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports
text: read MGI report R use read_report():
code: library(mgi.report.reader)  base_url <- "https://www.informatics.jax.org/downloads/reports" marker_list1_rpt <- file.path(base_url, "MRK_List1.rpt") coordinates_rpt <- file.path(base_url, "MGI_MRK_Coord.rpt")  # Import the Mouse Genetic Markers (including withdrawn marker symbols) Report read_report(marker_list1_rpt, "MRK_List1", n_max = 10L) #> # A tibble: 10 × 12 #>    marker_id   marker_symbol marker_name marker_type status cM_pos chr     start #>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <fct>       <fct>   <dbl> <fct>   <int> #>  1 MGI:1341858 03B03F        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  2 MGI:1341869 03B03R        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  3 MGI:1337005 03.MMHAP34FR… DNA segmen… DNA Segment O        NA   11    NA      #>  4 <NA>        0610005A07Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   3     NA      #>  5 MGI:1918911 0610005C13Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        29.4 7      4.52e7 #>  6 <NA>        0610005K03Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   15    NA      #>  7 <NA>        0610005M07Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   6     NA      #>  8 <NA>        0610006A03Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   4     NA      #>  9 <NA>        0610006A11Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   <NA>  NA      #> 10 <NA>        0610006C01Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   <NA>  NA      #> # ℹ 4 more variables: end <int>, strand <fct>, feature_type <fct>, #> #   synonyms <list> # Import the MGI Marker Coordinates' Report read_report(coordinates_rpt, "MGI_MRK_Coord", n_max = 10L) #> # A tibble: 10 × 12 #>    marker_id marker_type marker_symbol marker_name  genome_assembly chr    start #>    <chr>     <fct>       <chr>         <chr>        <fct>           <fct>  <int> #>  1 MGI:87853 Gene        a             nonagouti    GRCm39          2     1.55e8 #>  2 MGI:87854 Gene        Pzp           PZP, alpha-… GRCm39          6     1.28e8 #>  3 MGI:87881 Gene        Acp1          acid phosph… GRCm39          12    3.09e7 #>  4 MGI:87926 Gene        Adh7          alcohol deh… GRCm39          3     1.38e8 #>  5 MGI:87929 Gene        Adh5          alcohol deh… GRCm39          3     1.38e8 #>  6 MGI:87859 Gene        Abl1          c-abl oncog… GRCm39          2     3.16e7 #>  7 MGI:87882 Gene        Acp2          acid phosph… GRCm39          2     9.10e7 #>  8 MGI:87862 Gene        Scgb1b27      secretoglob… GRCm39          7     3.37e7 #>  9 MGI:87883 Gene        Acp5          acid phosph… GRCm39          9     2.20e7 #> 10 MGI:87930 Gene        Adk           adenosine k… GRCm39          14    2.11e7 #> # ℹ 5 more variables: end <int>, strand <fct>, feature_type <fct>, #> #   provider <fct>, provider_display <fct>

title: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports
text: Firstly, use package please forget start citing Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) Jackson Laboratory (JAX) original providers data made accessible readers. details cite MGI resources, please refer : https://www.informatics.jax.org/mgihome//citation.shtml. cite us, see https://www.pattern.institute/mgi.report.reader/authors.html#citation.

title: Mouse chromosomes — chromosomes
text: chromosomes() returns mouse chromosome names.

title: Mouse chromosomes — chromosomes
code: chromosomes(autosomal = TRUE, sexual = TRUE, mitochondrial = TRUE)

title: Mouse chromosomes — chromosomes
text: autosomal Whether include autosomal chromosomes (1 thru 19). sexual Whether include sexual chromosomes (X Y). mitochondrial Whether include mitochondrial chromosome (MT).

title: Mouse chromosomes — chromosomes
text: character vector mouse chromosome names, subset thereof, empty character vector.

title: Genome Feature Type Definitions — feature_types
text: dataset containing different types gene genome features along Sequence Ontology () identifiers definitions.

title: Genome Feature Type Definitions — feature_types
text: tibble 71 rows 3 variables: feature_type Character. type gene genome feature. so_id Character. Sequence Ontology identifier associated feature type. definition Character. definition feature type.

text: table https://www.informatics.jax.org/userhelp/GENE_feature_types_help.shtml terms found MGI reports.

what: mgi.report.reader: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports — mgi.report.reader-package
title: mgi.report.reader: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports — mgi.report.reader-package
text: Provides readers easy consistent importing Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) report files: https://www.informatics.jax.org/downloads/reports/index.html. data provided Baldarelli RM, Smith CL, Ringwald M, Richardson JE, Bult CJ, Mouse Genome Informatics Group. (2024) doi:10.1093/genetics/iyae031 .

title: mgi.report.reader: Read Mouse Genome Informatics Reports — mgi.report.reader-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno rmagno@pattern.institute (ORCID) Authors: Isabel Duarte iduarte@pattern.institute (ORCID) Ismail Gbadamosi .gbadamosi@nencki.edu.pl (ORCID) Ali Jawaid .jawaid@nencki.edu.pl (ORCID) contributors: Nencki Institute Experimental Biology [funder] University Algarve [funder] Pattern Institute [copyright holder, funder]

what: Read a marker list report — read_mrk_list_rpt
title: Read a marker list report — read_mrk_list_rpt
text: read_mrk_list_rpt() imports either MRK_List1.rpt MRK_List2.rpt report file. See MGI Data Statistical Reports details.

title: Read a marker list report — read_mrk_list_rpt
Read a marker list report — read_mrk_list_rpt
text: file Path report file.

title: Read a marker list report — read_mrk_list_rpt
text: tibble following variables (subset ): marker_id Character. unique MGI identifier marker. marker_symbol Character. MGI symbol representing marker. marker_name Character. full name marker. marker_type Factor. type marker (e.g., Gene, BAC/YAC end, DNA segment). status Factor. status marker (e.g., "O" official "W" withdrawn). cM_pos Double. position marker centiMorgans (cM) chromosome. chr Factor. chromosome marker located. start Integer. start position marker chromosome. end Integer. end position marker chromosome. strand Factor. DNA strand marker located (e.g., plus ("+") minus ("-")). feature_type Character. feature type marker (e.g., gene, lncRNA gene, DNA segment). cases sequence ontology term. synonyms List-column. list synonyms marker.

title: Read an MGI report — read_report
text: read_report() reads MGI report.

title: Read an MGI report — read_report
code: read_report(   report_file,   report_type = c("MRK_List1", "MRK_List2", "MGI_MRK_Coord", "MGI_Gene_Model_Coord",     "MGI_GTGUP", "MRK_Sequence", "MRK_SwissProt_TrEMBL", "MRK_SwissProt", "MRK_GeneTrap",     "MRK_ENSEMBL", "MGI_BioTypeConflict", "PRB_PrimerSeq", "MGI_InterProDomains"),   n_max = Inf )

title: Read an MGI report — read_report
text: report_file path URL MGI report file. report_type Report type, one : "MRK_List1": Mouse Genetic Markers (including withdrawn marker symbols). "MRK_List2": Mouse Genetic Markers (excluding withdrawn marker symbols). "MGI_MRK_Coord": MGI Marker Coordinates. "MGI_GTGUP": MGI Sequence Coordinates. "MRK_Sequence": MGI Marker associations Sequence (GenBank, RefSeq, Ensembl) information. "MRK_SwissProt_TrEMBL": MGI Marker associations SWISS-PROT TrEMBL protein IDs. "MRK_SwissProt": MGI Marker associations SWISS-PROT protein IDs. "MRK_GeneTrap": MGI Marker associations Gene Trap IDs. "MRK_ENSEMBL": MGI Marker associations Ensembl sequence information. "MGI_BioTypeConflict": MGI Marker associations Ensembl NCBI gene models gene vs. pseudogene discrepancy exists. "PRB_PrimerSeq": MGI Marker associations primer pairs. "MGI_InterProDomains": InterPro domain associations MGI markers. n_max Maximum number lines read.

title: Read an MGI report — read_report
text: tibble report data tidy format.

title: Read an MGI report — read_report
code: base_url <- "https://www.informatics.jax.org/downloads/reports" url <- file.path(base_url, "MRK_List1.rpt") # Import the Mouse Genetic Markers (including withdrawn marker symbols) Report read_report(url, "MRK_List1", n_max = 10L) #> # A tibble: 10 × 12 #>    marker_id   marker_symbol marker_name marker_type status cM_pos chr     start #>    <chr>       <chr>         <chr>       <fct>       <fct>   <dbl> <fct>   <int> #>  1 MGI:1341858 03B03F        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  2 MGI:1341869 03B03R        DNA segmen… BAC/YAC end O        NA   5     NA      #>  3 MGI:1337005 03.MMHAP34FR… DNA segmen… DNA Segment O        NA   11    NA      #>  4 NA          0610005A07Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   3     NA      #>  5 MGI:1918911 0610005C13Rik RIKEN cDNA… Gene        O        29.4 7      4.52e7 #>  6 NA          0610005K03Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   15    NA      #>  7 NA          0610005M07Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   6     NA      #>  8 NA          0610006A03Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   4     NA      #>  9 NA          0610006A11Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   NA    NA      #> 10 NA          0610006C01Rik withdrawn,… Gene        W        NA   NA    NA      #> # ℹ 4 more variables: end <int>, strand <fct>, feature_type <fct>, #> #   synonyms <list>

title: mgi.report.reader 0.0.1
text: Initial CRAN submission.
